column4: I am trying to install php 5.2 on natty. by default apt installs 5.3. how do i install an older version?

follow up question: The link assumes I have already installed php5 . I have a fresh machine with nothing installed. Would the process be the same? I mean is there something like apt-get install php5.2 ? I am sorry to ask again, but this is all very new to me.
then skip the steps which assume you have php 5.3

hi again. Ok so I did as was described on the page and it worked. i now have php 5.2 installed and it works perfectly. But I am trying to install phpmyadmin and it says it depends on php5-mycrypt which when i try to install says it depends on some php-cgi... which when i try to install it says its an abstract package that is provided by some php 5.3 packages. what to do?
ok. then install manually? never done it. ok lemme try.
all you have to is (I've done it) extract it under /var/www
then log on with your mysql root
/var/www would be where my public_html is right? because i have my site configured to run from /srv/www/mysite/ should i put it there?
put it under /srv/www/mysite then, /var/www/ is default
